definition_1: In a higher position than something.
definition_2: More than a certain number or level.
example_1: Our apartment is above the bakery.
example_2: See the instructions listed above.

definition_1: A written or spoken description of an event.
example_1: He gave the police a full account of what happened.
example_2: The newspaper account of the fire was very detailed.

example_1: The company acquired a new building.
example_2: She quickly acquired the skill of programming.

definition_3: A distinct time in the past.
example_1: We are living in the digital age.
example_2: The museum had artifacts from the Stone Age.

definition_1: The science or practice of farming.
definition_4: The business of producing food from the land.
example_1: Agriculture is very important to the country's economy.
example_2: New technology has changed modern agriculture.

example_1: All of a sudden, the lights went out.
example_2: He left all of a sudden without saying goodbye.

example_1: I am not altogether sure that's a good idea.
example_2: Altogether, the project will cost $10,000.

example_1: I am anxious about the test results.
example_2: He was anxious to get home.

definition_3: Seeming to be true, but maybe not.
example_1: It was apparent that she was not happy.
example_2: The solution to the problem is apparent.

definition_1: Suitable or right for a situation.
example_1: That movie is not appropriate for children.
example_2: Please wear appropriate clothes for the interview.

definition_2: The feeling or mood of a place.
example_1: The atmosphere at the party was very relaxed.
example_2: We need to stop polluting the atmosphere.

definition_1: Done by a machine, without human control.
example_1: The doors open automatically.
example_2: He automatically said "bless you" when she sneezed.

example_1: The milk smells bad; I think it's gone off.
example_2: Don't eat that apple; it's bad.

definition_1: To be the person who controls or manages something.
example_1: She is in charge of the entire department.
example_2: Who is in charge here?

definition_1: To be in a particular place.
example_1: The hotel is situated by the lake.
example_2: The town is situated in a beautiful valley.

definition_1: Slower or less successful than others.
example_1: He is behind the rest of the class in math.
example_2: We are behind schedule on this project.

definition_1: To feel sure that something exists.
definition_2: To trust or have faith in an idea.
definition_3: To think something is good or right.
example_1: Do you believe in ghosts?
example_2: I believe in the importance of hard work.

definition_2: The state of being at fault.
example_1: He took the blame for the mistake.
example_2: It's not my blame; it was an accident.

definition_1: To stop something from moving past.
definition_3: To get in the way of.
example_1: A fallen tree is blocking the road.
example_2: He blocked my view.

example_1: She has a brilliant mind.
example_2: That was a brilliant idea!

definition_1: To care for a child until they grow up.
example_1: She was brought up by her grandmother.
example_2: They brought up their children to be polite.

definition_1: To find a number or amount using math.
example_1: I need to calculate how much this will cost.
example_2: Can you calculate the total?

example_1: You should wear warm clothing in winter.
example_2: She bought some new clothing for the party.

definition_1: Wanting to win or be the best.
definition_3: As good as or better than others.
definition_4: Having a strong desire to win.
example_1: He is a very competitive person.
example_2: The market is very competitive.

example_1: The museum shows contemporary art.
example_2: He is a contemporary of my father (they are the same age).

definition_2: An event where people try to win.
example_1: She won the singing contest.
example_2: I entered a contest to win a new car.

definition_1: One of the large landmasses of the Earth (e.g., Asia).
definition_2: A very large area of land.
definition_3: One of the 7 main land areas.
definition_4: A main part of the globe.
example_1: Africa is a very large continent.
example_2: He has traveled to every continent.

definition_1: A single example of a book, newspaper, etc.
example_1: I bought a copy of the new book.
example_2: Do you have a copy of the report?

definition_1: A standard used to judge something.
definition_2: A rule for making a decision.
example_1: What is the main criterion for the job?
example_2: The plural of criterion is criteria.

definition_1: To make a tree fall by cutting it.
definition_2: To reduce the amount of something.
example_1: They cut down the old tree.
example_2: I need to cut down on sugar.

example_1: The 1990s was a great decade.
example_2: He has lived here for over a decade.

definition_1: To announce something publicly or officially.
definition_2: To say something in a strong, clear way.
example_1: The government declared a state of emergency.
example_2: She declared that she would run for president.

definition_2: A title given by a college.
example_1: She has a degree in history.
example_2: He is studying for his Master's degree.

definition_1: To take goods or letters to a place.
definition_4: To help a woman give birth.
example_1: The mailman delivers the mail every morning.
example_2: He delivered a great speech.

definition_1: Needing a lot of effort, skill, or attention.
example_1: It is a very demanding job.
example_2: My boss is very demanding.

definition_1: To notice or find something that is hard to see.
example_1: The machine can detect small cracks in the metal.
example_2: The test can detect the virus.

definition_1: To discover the facts about something.
example_1: The police are trying to determine the cause of the accident.
example_2: Your test scores will determine your final grade.

example_1: Scientists differ on the cause of the problem.
example_2: I have to differ with you on that point.

definition_1: To be different from something else.
example_1: The two cars differ in size and price.
example_2: His opinion differs from mine.

definition_1: Unhappy because something was not as good as you hoped.
example_1: I was disappointed with my test results.
example_2: She was disappointed that he didn't call.

definition_1: To do a math calculation to see how many times one number fits in another.
example_1: What is 10 divided by 2?
example_2: The teacher divided the class into four groups.

example_1: The airline only offers domestic flights.
example_2: This news is about domestic policy, not foreign affairs.

definition_3: (For food) cooked and ready to eat.
example_1: My homework is done.
example_2: Is the chicken done yet?

definition_2: To make something two times bigger.
example_1: The company's profits doubled last year.
example_2: He doubled the recipe.

example_1: I had to pay double the normal price.
example_2: I am seeing double.

definition_1: Not using a lot of money, fuel, or time.
example_1: This car is very economical on gas.
example_2: It's more economical to buy in bulk.

definition_1: A person who checks and corrects writing.
definition_2: The person in charge of a newspaper.
definition_3: Someone who prepares text for printing.
example_1: She is the editor of a fashion magazine.
example_2: The editor made changes to my article.

definition_2: No matter which of the two things happens.
example_1: We can go to the movies or the park. Either way, I don't mind.
example_2: Either way, you have to make a decision.

example_1: Honesty is an important element of friendship.
example_2: The main elements of the story are love and war.

definition_1: To appear or come out from somewhere.
example_1: The sun emerged from behind the clouds.
example_2: New details have emerged about the story.

definition_1: A strong feeling (e.g., love, hate, fear).
example_1: He spoke with a lot of emotion.
example_2: Love is a powerful emotion.

definition_1: Someone or something not included in a rule.
definition_3: A case that does not follow the rule.
example_1: Everyone is here, with the exception of Tom.
example_2: I like all vegetables, with one exception: beets.

definition_1: To give one thing and get another in return.
example_1: We exchanged phone numbers.
example_2: I want to exchange this shirt for a larger size.

example_1: The expected time of arrival is 10 PM.
example_2: This is the expected result.

definition_1: A long journey for a special purpose.
definition_3: A group of people on such a trip.
example_1: They went on an expedition to the Arctic.
example_2: The expedition was a success.

definition_1: The cost or money needed for something.
example_1: The company will pay all your travel expenses.
example_2: He bought a new car at great expense.

definition_2: A product sent to another country.
example_1: The country's main export is coffee.
example_2: There is a ban on the export of these goods.

definition_1: To sell goods to another country.
example_1: The company exports its products all over the world.
example_2: We export more than we import.

example_1: "Break a leg" is a common expression.
example_2: I don't understand that expression.

definition_3: To continue for a longer time.
example_1: I need to extend my visa.
example_2: They extended the deadline by one week.

example_1: We are facing extreme danger.
example_2: He lives in extreme poverty.

definition_1: At or to a greater distance.
example_1: The station is farther than I thought.
example_2: We need to discuss this further.

definition_1: Bored, annoyed, or unhappy with something.
example_1: I am fed up with all this rain.
example_2: She was fed up with his excuses.

definition_4: To go for and return with.
example_1: Can you fetch my glasses from the kitchen?
example_2: The dog fetched the ball.

definition_1: The last game in a competition.
example_1: They lost in the final.
example_2: Our team reached the final.

example_1: He stays fit by running every day.
example_2: You need to be fit for this job.

definition_1: All people born at about the same time.
example_1: My parents' generation had different music.
example_2: This is a problem for future generations.

example_1: Is this a genuine diamond?
example_2: She showed genuine concern for me.

definition_1: To throw away something you don't want.
example_1: We need to get rid of this old sofa.
example_2: I can't get rid of this cold.

example_1: You got all the answers wrong.
example_2: Don't get me wrong, I like him, but he talks too much.

example_1: His health is getting worse.
example_2: The weather is getting worse.

example_1: She gave away all her old clothes.
example_2: Don't give away the ending of the movie!

definition_1: To leave your house to go to an event.
definition_2: (For a light or fire) To stop burning.
example_1: Are you going out tonight?
example_2: The power went out during the storm.

example_1: There is a hidden camera in the room.
example_2: The house is hidden by trees.

definition_4: To mark with a bright color.
example_1: The report highlights the main problems.
example_2: Please highlight the important words.

definition_1: A person who studies or writes about history.
definition_3: A person who researches the past.
example_1: The historian gave a lecture on ancient Rome.
example_2: He is a famous historian.

definition_2: Famous or significant from the past.
definition_3: Not just "historical" (from the past), but important.
example_1: This is a historic moment.
example_2: We visited a historic battlefield.

example_1: The two brothers are identical twins.
example_2: My keys are identical to yours.

definition_1: The act of coming to live in a new country.
definition_3: The process of entering a country.
example_1: The country has strict immigration laws.
example_2: Immigration has increased in recent years.

definition_1: To buy goods from another country.
example_1: The company imports coffee from Brazil.
example_2: We import most of our oil.

definition_1: A product brought from another country.
example_1: The car is a German import.
example_2: The country's imports are very high.

definition_2: To have a strong, positive effect.
example_1: He tried to impress her with his new car.
example_2: I was very impressed by her speech.

definition_1: The feeling or opinion you get about something.
example_1: He made a good impression at the interview.
example_2: My first impression was that he was very shy.

example_1: The view from the top was incredible.
example_2: He told an incredible story about his trip.

example_1: It's raining; let's stay indoors.
example_2: We played an indoor game.

definition_2: An illness in a part of the body.
example_1: He has a bad ear infection.
example_2: You must clean the cut to prevent infection.

definition_1: Information, ideas, or time put into something.
example_1: I need your input on this plan.
example_2: The computer is processing the input.

definition_1: A feeling you have in your mind or heart.
example_1: He looked calm, but inside he was very nervous.
example_2: I feel happy inside.

example_1: The job requires a lot of interaction with clients.
example_2: I enjoy the interaction with my colleagues.

definition_1: To translate someone's words as they speak.
definition_2: To explain the meaning of something.
example_1: He interprets for the president.
example_2: How do you interpret this poem?

definition_1: To stop someone while they are speaking.
example_1: Sorry to interrupt, but I have a question.
example_2: The game was interrupted by rain.

definition_1: The act of taking part in something.
example_1: His involvement in the project was essential.
example_2: The police suspect his involvement in the crime.

definition_3: A single copy of a magazine.
example_1: Money is a big issue for many people.
example_2: We need to discuss the issue of safety.

definition_1: Used to say how something seems.
example_1: It looks like it's going to rain.
example_2: It looks as if we'll be late.

definition_1: A situation where vehicles cannot move.
definition_3: A line of cars that is not moving.
example_1: We were stuck in a jam for over an hour.
example_2: I'm going to be late because of a traffic jam.

definition_1: A person who writes for newspapers or TV.
example_1: She is a journalist for a national newspaper.
example_2: The journalist interviewed the actor.

definition_1: The ability to make good decisions.
example_1: He showed poor judgment in this situation.
example_2: I trust her judgment.

example_1: This restaurant is just as good as the other one.
example_2: He is just as tall as his father.

definition_2: The quality of being fair and right.
example_1: He is fighting for justice.
example_2: The families of the victims want justice.

example_1: He is very keen to start his new job.
example_2: She is a keen follower of politics.

example_1: I'm sorry to keep you waiting.
example_2: What kept you? You're late.

definition_1: A set of tools or equipment.
definition_2: A collection of items for a purpose.
example_1: I have a first-aid kit in my car.
example_2: He bought a model airplane kit.

example_1: I need to learn these words for the test.
example_2: We learned a lot from the visit.

definition_1: A talk given to teach a subject.
example_1: I went to a lecture on modern art.
example_2: The professor gave a boring lecture.

definition_2: To talk for a long time (often angrily).
example_1: He lectures on history at the university.
example_2: Don't lecture me; I know what I'm doing.

example_1: The moon lit up the room.
example_2: Please light the candles.

definition_1: The money you need to live.
example_1: What do you do for a living?
example_2: He earns a good living as a doctor.

example_1: That is a logical conclusion.
example_2: You need to have a logical argument.

definition_1: To feel happy and excited about the future.
example_1: I am looking forward to my vacation.
example_2: She is looking forward to seeing him.

example_1: Please lower your voice.
example_2: They lowered the flag.

example_1: What you are saying does not make sense.
example_2: This plan makes sense.

example_1: Women make up 60% of the workforce.
example_2: This team is made up of young players.

example_1: You need to make up your mind about where to go.
example_2: I can't make my mind up.

definition_1: To repair something that is broken.
example_1: Can you mend this broken chair?

example_1: The city is a mixture of old and new buildings.
example_2: Add the flour to the egg mixture.

example_1: We have a monthly team meeting.

definition_1: Something that is hard to understand or explain.
example_1: The cause of the accident is a mystery.
example_2: I love reading mystery novels.

definition_1: To say the name of someone.
example_1: He refused to name the people involved.
example_2: The police named him as the main suspect.

definition_2: Relating to the place you were born.
example_1: English is not my native language.
example_2: He is a native New Yorker.

definition_1: Used to connect two negative ideas.
definition_2: Not the first and not the second.
example_1: Neither my brother nor my sister can come.
example_2: I like neither the blue shirt nor the red one.

example_1: I had a nightmare last night.
example_2: The trip was a complete nightmare.

definition_1: Ideas that are silly or not true.

example_2: Everything he said was complete nonsense.

definition_1: To not say anything at all.
example_1: He didn't say a word all evening.
example_2: I don't believe a word he says.

definition_3: Used to emphasize a late start.
example_1: I did not understand the problem until he explained it.
example_2: Not until I got home did I realize I lost my keys.

definition_3: The act of controlling a place (by army).
example_1: What is your occupation?
example_2: His occupation is a teacher.

definition_1: To fill or use a space or time.
example_1: This problem occupies all my time.
example_2: The empty chairs were occupied by coats.

definition_1: The fuel used for cars, heating, etc.
example_1: The price of oil has increased.
example_2: We need to put oil in the car.

example_1: On the whole, I am happy with my new job.
example_2: The movie was, on the whole, very good.

example_1: The new hospital will be opened by the Queen.
example_2: They opened the new store last week.

definition_2: To cut a body to fix it.
definition_3: To use or control a machine.
example_1: The doctor will operate on his leg tomorrow.
example_2: Do you know how to operate this machine?

definition_1: A part of the body with a special function.
example_1: The heart is a vital organ.
example_2: He needs an organ transplant.

example_1: This project needs better organization.
example_2: The organization of the event was perfect.

example_1: He gave an outstanding performance.
example_2: She is an outstanding student.

definition_1: For only some of the usual hours.
example_1: He has a part-time job at the supermarket.
example_2: She works part-time.

example_1: You need to be patient with children.
example_2: Please be patient; the doctor will see you soon.

definition_4: Specific to one person or thing.
example_1: That is a very peculiar smell.
example_2: He has a peculiar way of talking.

definition_1: A spot in a university course.
example_1: She got a place at Harvard.
example_2: He finished in third place.

example_1: At this point, we can't turn back.
example_2: That was the turning point of the game.

definition_1: To aim or hold something towards a target.
definition_2: To face something in a direction.
example_1: He pointed the gun at the target.
example_2: Don't point your finger at people.

example_1: This puts me in a difficult position.
example_2: I am not in a position to help you.

definition_2: The ability to develop or succeed.
example_1: The new drug has the potential to cure the disease.
example_2: She has a lot of potential as a singer.

definition_1: Liking one thing more than another.
definition_2: A greater interest in one thing.
example_1: Do you have a preference for tea or coffee?
example_2: My personal preference is the blue one.

example_1: The mayor presented the award to the winner.
example_2: I would like to present my new idea.

definition_1: A feeling of stress or worry.
example_1: I am under a lot of pressure at work.

example_1: Our prime concern is safety.
example_2: He is in his prime (best time of life).

example_1: The principal reason for my visit is to see you.
example_2: What is the principal cause of the problem?

definition_2: The person in charge of a school.
example_1: The principal gave a speech at the assembly.
example_2: I was sent to the principal's office.

definition_1: To give someone a higher job or rank.
example_1: She was promoted to manager.
example_2: The company promoted him.

definition_1: To accept an unpleasant situation or person.
example_1: I can't put up with this noise anymore.
example_2: She has to put up with a lot of pain.

definition_1: To stretch your arm to touch something.
example_1: I can't reach the top shelf.

example_1: He lost his reason (went crazy).
example_2: You must use reason to solve this.

example_1: The meeting was recorded.

example_1: We keep a record of all sales.
example_2: He broke the world record.

definition_1: To show an image of something.
example_1: The water reflected the blue sky.
example_2: His face was reflected in the mirror.

definition_3: A machine that holds money (cash register).
example_1: Is your name on the register?
example_2: We need to check the hotel register.

definition_1: To put your name on an official list.
example_1: You must register to vote.
example_2: I registered for the new course.

definition_1: To feel sad or sorry about something.
definition_3: To feel bad about a past action.
example_1: I regret not studying harder.
example_2: He regrets his decision.

definition_1: A feeling of sadness about the past.
example_1: I have no regrets about leaving.
example_2: He expressed deep regret for his actions.

example_1: I can't relate these two ideas.
example_2: The report relates to the new project.

example_1: I just want to relax on the beach.
example_2: Relax! Everything will be fine.

example_1: He remarked that the weather was nice.
example_2: "This is easy," she remarked.

example_1: He made a rude remark.
example_2: That was an interesting remark.

example_1: They live in a remote village in the mountains.
example_2: I work in a remote location.

definition_1: To take the place of something.
definition_2: To put a new thing in place of an old one.
example_1: I need to replace the battery in my watch.
example_2: Who will replace the old manager?

definition_3: To get someone out of a bad situation.
example_1: The firefighter rescued the child.
example_2: We rescued the dog from the river.

example_1: The rescue team arrived quickly.
example_2: It was a difficult rescue.

definition_1: To admire or have a good opinion of.
example_1: You should respect your teachers.
example_2: I respect his opinion, but I disagree.

example_1: He has a lot of respect for his boss.
example_2: Show some respect!

definition_1: To stop working, usually because of age.
example_1: He will retire next year.
example_2: My father retired at age 65.

example_1: It's not right to steal.
example_2: He did the right thing.

definition_1: The function or purpose of something.
definition_2: A part in a play or movie.

example_2: He plays the role of the bad guy.

example_1: Is there enough room for me in the car?
example_2: There is no room for doubt.

example_1: Can you give me a rough idea of the cost?
example_2: This is just a rough calculation.

example_1: You must follow the rules.
example_2: It's against the rules to cheat.

definition_4: To be the king or queen.
example_1: The queen ruled for 50 years.
example_2: The king rules the country.

definition_1: To manage or operate a business.
example_1: She runs her own company.
example_2: He runs the new project.

definition_1: To move or act very quickly.

example_2: Don't rush; take your time.

example_1: I'm in a rush; I can't talk.

definition_1: To make someone happy or pleased.
definition_2: To meet a need or requirement.
example_1: The food did not satisfy me.

definition_1: The size or level of something.
example_1: This is a problem on a massive scale.

definition_1: A part of a play or movie.
definition_4: A single part of a film.

definition_1: A plan of what you will do and when.
example_1: What is your schedule for today?
example_2: The train is on schedule.

example_1: Be careful what you say; he's very sensitive.

definition_2: Work done to help society (e.g., army).

example_2: He did his military service.

example_1: There is no set time for the meeting.
example_2: We have a set budget.

definition_1: The place and time of a story or film.

example_1: I will be back shortly.
example_2: The movie will start shortly.

definition_1: To make a business or machine stop working.

example_2: You need to shut down the computer.

definition_2: A way in which things are alike.
example_1: There is a strong similarity between the two brothers.
example_2: I see the similarity.

definition_1: To make something or someone move slower.
definition_3: To cause to be less fast.
example_1: The snow slowed down the traffic.
example_2: You need to slow down; you're driving too fast.

definition_1: Used to show you don't agree with the name.
example_1: This is his so-called "expert" friend.
example_2: The so-called solution only made things worse.

example_1: I joined the university's history society.
example_2: The high school has a drama society.

definition_2: At some point in the future.
example_1: Sooner or later, you will have to tell him the truth.
example_2: We will all need help sooner or later.

example_1: The view from the mountain was spectacular.
example_2: It was a spectacular show.

definition_1: A formal talk given to a group.
example_1: The president gave a long speech.
example_2: Her speech was very inspiring.

definition_4: To treat a child too well.
example_1: Don't spoil the surprise!
example_2: The rain spoiled our picnic.

example_1: Let's start off the meeting with a review.
example_2: He started off as a waiter.

definition_1: A particular way of doing something.
example_1: I like his style of writing.
example_2: That's a very unique style of painting.

definition_1: To give the main points of something.
example_1: To sum up, we need more time and money.
example_2: Can you sum up the book in one sentence?

definition_1: A short text giving the main points.
example_1: Write a summary of the article.
example_2: He gave a short summary of the meeting.

definition_1: To help someone by giving money.
example_1: He supports his favorite team every week.
example_2: He still has to support his elderly parents.

example_1: I need your support.
example_2: The project has financial support.

definition_2: To continue to live after a disaster.
definition_3: To get through a difficult time.
example_1: Not many people survived the crash.
example_2: It's hard to survive on such a low salary.

example_1: You must take his age into account.
example_2: We took the weather into account when planning.

example_1: Did you take part in the competition?
example_2: Everyone took part in the discussion.

example_1: The meeting will take place on Monday.
example_2: The story takes place in New York.

definition_1: To use a chance to do something.
definition_3: To do something when you can.
example_1: I'd like to take this opportunity to thank you.
example_2: You should take the opportunity to travel.

definition_1: To believe someone or something is important.
example_1: You should take his warning seriously.
example_2: No one takes him seriously.

definition_1: To accept the blame or duty for something.
example_1: You must take responsibility for your actions.
example_2: He took responsibility for the mistake.

definition_1: The main stories in the news.
example_1: The story was in all the headlines.
example_2: He is famous for making the headlines.

example_1: We live in the heart of the city.
example_2: We need to get to the heart of the problem.

example_1: The main thing is to stay calm.
example_2: Don't worry about the details; the main thing is it works.

example_1: The reality of the situation is very serious.
example_2: He needs to face the reality of his problems.

example_1: The theme of the book is love and war.
example_2: What is the theme of your party?

definition_1: Used to show the end point of a range.
example_1: The price is from $10 to $20.
example_2: It takes 30 to 40 minutes.

example_1: To start with, let's review the old plan.
example_2: The party was great, but to start with, it was boring.

example_1: The pirates looked for buried treasure.
example_2: This old photo is a real treasure.

example_1: I'll give it a try.
example_2: He passed the test on his first try.

definition_1: A chance or opportunity to do something.
example_1: It's your turn to play.
example_2: Please wait your turn.

example_1: This chair is very uncomfortable.
example_2: I felt uncomfortable in the meeting.

example_1: The cat is underneath the table.
example_2: What's underneath this?

example_1: I understand you are in a difficult situation.
example_2: He doesn't understand my feelings.

definition_1: To cancel the effect of something.
example_1: I can't undo my mistake.
example_2: Press this button to undo the last change.

example_1: He has been unemployed for six months.
example_2: The number of unemployed people is rising.

example_1: We had some unexpected visitors.
example_2: The news was completely unexpected.

example_1: This is a very up-to-date computer.
example_2: I need to get up-to-date news.

example_1: I have an urgent message for you.
example_2: This is an urgent problem.

definition_1: To finish the supply of something.
example_1: We used up all the milk.
example_2: Don't use up all the paper.

definition_1: A computer-made environment that seems real.
example_1: Virtual reality games are very popular.
example_2: They use virtual reality to train pilots.

definition_2: A sound made with an open mouth.
example_1: The word "book" has two vowels.
example_2: English has 5 main vowels.

definition_1: To use too much of something.
example_1: Don't waste your money on that.
example_2: You are wasting my time.

example_1: It was a waste of time.
example_2: This is a waste of effort.

definition_1: A large amount of money or property.
example_1: He is a man of great wealth.
example_2: The country's wealth comes from oil.

definition_1: To support or be happy about an idea.
example_1: We welcome your feedback.
example_2: The company welcomed the new rules.

example_1: The rain was a welcome change after the hot day.
example_2: Your help is always welcome.

example_1: Sit wherever you like.
example_2: I will follow you wherever you go.
